name: collision
description: The collision properties of a link. Note that this can be different from the visual properties of a link, for example, simpler collision models are often used to reduce computation time.

children.name: name
children.description: Unique name for the collision element within the scope of the parent link.

children.name: laser_retro
children.description: intensity value returned by laser sensor.

children.name: max_contacts
children.description: Maximum number of contacts allowed between two entities. This value overrides the max_contacts element defined in physics.

children.name: density
children.description: Mass Density of the collision geometry. This is used to determine mass and inertia values during automatic calculation. Default is the density of water 1000 kg/m^3.

children.name: auto_inertia_params
children.description: Parent tag to hold user-defined custom params for mesh inertia calculator

children.name: pose
children.description: A pose (translation, rotation) expressed in the frame named by @relative_to. The first three components (x, y, z) represent the position of the element's origin (in the @relative_to frame). The rotation component represents the orientation of the element as either a sequence of Euler rotations (r, p, y), see http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=specify_pose, or as a quaternion (x, y, z, w), where w is the real component.

children.name: relative_to
children.description: If specified, this pose is expressed in the named frame. The named frame must be declared within the same scope (world/model) as the element that has its pose specified by this tag. If missing, the pose is expressed in the frame of the parent XML element of the element that contains the pose. For exceptions to this rule and more details on the default behavior, see http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics. Note that @relative_to merely affects an element's initial pose and does not affect the element's dynamic movement thereafter. New in v1.8: @relative_to may use frames of nested scopes. In this case, the frame is specified using `::` as delimiter to define the scope of the frame, e.g. `nested_model_A::nested_model_B::awesome_frame`.

children.name: rotation_format
children.description: 'euler_rpy' by default. Supported rotation formats are 'euler_rpy', Euler angles representation in roll, pitch, yaw. The pose is expected to have 6 values. 'quat_xyzw', Quaternion representation in x, y, z, w. The pose is expected to have 7 values.

children.name: degrees
children.description: Whether or not the euler angles are in degrees, otherwise they will be interpreted as radians by default.

children.name: geometry
children.description: The shape of the visual or collision object.

children.name: surface
children.description: The surface parameters

children.name: restitution_coefficient
children.description: Bounciness coefficient of restitution, from [0...1], where 0=no bounciness.

children.name: threshold
children.description: Bounce capture velocity, below which effective coefficient of restitution is 0.

children.name: torsional
children.description: Parameters for torsional friction

children.name: coefficient
children.description: Torsional friction coefficient, unitless maximum ratio of tangential stress to normal stress.

children.name: use_patch_radius
children.description: If this flag is true, torsional friction is calculated using the "patch_radius" parameter. If this flag is set to false, "surface_radius" (R) and contact depth (d) are used to compute the patch radius as sqrt(R*d).

children.name: patch_radius
children.description: Radius of contact patch surface.

children.name: surface_radius
children.description: Surface radius on the point of contact.

children.name: ode
children.description: Torsional friction parameters for ODE

children.name: slip
children.description: Force dependent slip for torsional friction, equivalent to inverse of viscous damping coefficient with units of rad/s/(Nm). A slip value of 0 is infinitely viscous.

children.name: ode
children.description: ODE friction parameters

children.name: mu
children.description: Coefficient of friction in first friction pyramid direction, the unitless maximum ratio of force in first friction pyramid direction to normal force.

children.name: mu2
children.description: Coefficient of friction in second friction pyramid direction, the unitless maximum ratio of force in second friction pyramid direction to normal force.

children.name: fdir1
children.description: Unit vector specifying first friction pyramid direction in collision-fixed reference frame. If the friction pyramid model is in use, and this value is set to a unit vector for one of the colliding surfaces, the ODE Collide callback function will align the friction pyramid directions with a reference frame fixed to that collision surface. If both surfaces have this value set to a vector of zeros, the friction pyramid directions will be aligned with the world frame. If this value is set for both surfaces, the behavior is undefined.

children.name: slip1
children.description: Force dependent slip in first friction pyramid direction, equivalent to inverse of viscous damping coefficient with units of m/s/N. A slip value of 0 is infinitely viscous.

children.name: slip2
children.description: Force dependent slip in second friction pyramid direction, equivalent to inverse of viscous damping coefficient with units of m/s/N. A slip value of 0 is infinitely viscous.

children.name: friction
children.description: Coefficient of friction in first friction pyramid direction, the unitless maximum ratio of force in first friction pyramid direction to normal force.

children.name: friction2
children.description: Coefficient of friction in second friction pyramid direction, the unitless maximum ratio of force in second friction pyramid direction to normal force.

children.name: fdir1
children.description: Unit vector specifying first friction pyramid direction in collision-fixed reference frame. If the friction pyramid model is in use, and this value is set to a unit vector for one of the colliding surfaces, the friction pyramid directions will be aligned with a reference frame fixed to that collision surface. If both surfaces have this value set to a vector of zeros, the friction pyramid directions will be aligned with the world frame. If this value is set for both surfaces, the behavior is undefined.

children.name: rolling_friction
children.description: Coefficient of rolling friction

children.name: collide_without_contact
children.description: Flag to disable contact force generation, while still allowing collision checks and contact visualization to occur.

children.name: collide_without_contact_bitmask
children.description: Bitmask for collision filtering when collide_without_contact is on

children.name: collide_bitmask
children.description: Bitmask for collision filtering. This will override collide_without_contact. Parsed as 16-bit unsigned integer.

children.name: category_bitmask
children.description: Bitmask for category of collision filtering. Collision happens if ((category1 & collision2) | (category2 & collision1)) is not zero. If not specified, the category_bitmask should be interpreted as being the same as collide_bitmask. Parsed as 16-bit unsigned integer.

children.name: poissons_ratio
children.description: Poisson's ratio is the unitless ratio between transverse and axial strain. This value must lie between (-1, 0.5). Defaults to 0.3 for typical steel. Note typical silicone elastomers have Poisson's ratio near 0.49 ~ 0.50. For reference, approximate values for Material:(Young's Modulus, Poisson's Ratio) for some of the typical materials are: Plastic: (1e8 ~ 3e9 Pa, 0.35 ~ 0.41), Wood: (4e9 ~ 1e10 Pa, 0.22 ~ 0.50), Aluminum: (7e10 Pa, 0.32 ~ 0.35), Steel: (2e11 Pa, 0.26 ~ 0.31).

children.name: elastic_modulus
children.description: Young's Modulus in SI derived unit Pascal. Defaults to -1. If value is less or equal to zero, contact using elastic modulus (with Poisson's Ratio) is disabled. For reference, approximate values for Material:(Young's Modulus, Poisson's Ratio) for some of the typical materials are: Plastic: (1e8 ~ 3e9 Pa, 0.35 ~ 0.41), Wood: (4e9 ~ 1e10 Pa, 0.22 ~ 0.50), Aluminum: (7e10 Pa, 0.32 ~ 0.35), Steel: (2e11 Pa, 0.26 ~ 0.31).

children.name: ode
children.description: ODE contact parameters

children.name: soft_cfm
children.description: Soft constraint force mixing.

children.name: soft_erp
children.description: Soft error reduction parameter

children.name: kp
children.description: dynamically "stiffness"-equivalent coefficient for contact joints

children.name: kd
children.description: dynamically "damping"-equivalent coefficient for contact joints

children.name: max_vel
children.description: maximum contact correction velocity truncation term.

children.name: min_depth
children.description: minimum allowable depth before contact correction impulse is applied

children.name: bullet
children.description: Bullet contact parameters

children.name: soft_cfm
children.description: Soft constraint force mixing.

children.name: soft_erp
children.description: Soft error reduction parameter

children.name: kp
children.description: dynamically "stiffness"-equivalent coefficient for contact joints

children.name: kd
children.description: dynamically "damping"-equivalent coefficient for contact joints

children.name: split_impulse
children.description: Similar to ODE's max_vel implementation. See http://bulletphysics.org/mediawiki-1.5.8/index.php/BtContactSolverInfo#Split_Impulse for more information.

children.name: split_impulse_penetration_threshold
children.description: Similar to ODE's max_vel implementation. See http://bulletphysics.org/mediawiki-1.5.8/index.php/BtContactSolverInfo#Split_Impulse for more information.

children.name: dart
children.description: soft contact pamameters based on paper: http://www.cc.gatech.edu/graphics/projects/Sumit/homepage/papers/sigasia11/jain_softcontacts_siga11.pdf

children.name: bone_attachment
children.description: This is variable k_v in the soft contacts paper. Its unit is N/m.

children.name: stiffness
children.description: This is variable k_e in the soft contacts paper. Its unit is N/m.

children.name: damping
children.description: Viscous damping of point velocity in body frame. Its unit is N/m/s.

children.name: flesh_mass_fraction
children.description: Fraction of mass to be distributed among deformable nodes.
